parameters.name: obj
parameters.description:
A pointer to the atomic object (see the
  atomic_* types)
  whose value you want to read.

parameters.name: desired
parameters.description:
The value for the object.
  The “C” represents the non-atomic data type that corresponds to the atomic object.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
(atomic_exchange_explicit() only) The
  memory_order
  to use for the operation.

full_content:
Function: atomic_exchange_explicit
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/atomic_exchange.html
Synopsis: C atomic_exchange_explicit( volatile A *obj,
Headers: #include <stdatomic.h>
Parameters:
  - obj: A pointer to the atomic object (see the
  atomic_* types)
  whose value you want to read.
  - desired: The value for the object.
  The “C” represents the non-atomic data type that corresponds to the atomic object.
  - order: (atomic_exchange_explicit() only) The
  memory_order
  to use for the operation.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <stdatomic.h>

C atomic_exchange( volatile A *obj,
                   C desired );

C atomic_exchange_explicit( volatile A *obj,
                            C desired,
                            memory_order order );
